Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Removing Cristina from CODEOWNERS" (#8398) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Add build extensions to GalleryTools" (#8399) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Add build extensions to GalleryTools" (#8399) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Removing Cristina from CODEOWNERS" (#8398) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Reserved namespace error should mention a link to docs (aka.ms?)" (#8397) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

When a user pushes a new package to NuGet.org and the ID is under  a reserved namespace, we show this error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/105903905-572a6100-5fd5-11eb-8102-761e5ee19100.png)

This should mention a link to docs:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/nuget-org/id-prefix-reservation

Requested by @anangaur

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "get download statistic for my organization packages with API" (#8396) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi!
Marketing team in my organization is wondering if there is a way to get download statistic automatically?
We push packages to nuget.org using your API, do you have any method to get package info, including download statistic?
For package we need:
1. Total downloads
2. Unique IP Address Downloads

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Download stats are showing unlisted packages" (#10487) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: nuget.org

Product version:  Website

## Repro steps and/or sample project

Create an unlisted version.
Generate some downloads for it.
Visit the downloads page, and note that unlisted packages are... listed:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1378165/105942706-9f1ca880-6014-11eb-8015-c17897346878.png)

Unlisted packages should only show here if you're signed in as a package owner.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Updating in PMUI causes Object reference not set to an instance of an object" (#9882) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.7.0.6726

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):  Dev16 16.7.0

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): 18363.959

Install SpecFlow extension for VS 2019

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a .net framework 4.7.2 class library

2. Open Package manage UI, install following package.

- SpecFlow 3.3.74
- SpecFlow.Nunit 3.3.74
- SpecFlow.Tools.MSbuild.Generation.3.3.74
- NUnit 3.12.0
- NUnit3TestAdapter 3.17.0
- NUnit.ConsoleRuner 3.11.1

3. Updates tab.
Select all packages -> Update

Error: object reference not set to an instance of an object

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.UIActionEngine.<>c.<ResolveActionsForUpdateAsync>b__11_0(PackageIdentity package)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereListIterator`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.Any[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.UIActionEngine.<ResolveActionsForUpdateAsync>d__11.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ValidateEnd(Task task)
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.UIActionEngine.<>c__DisplayClass12_0.<<PerformActionImplAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext()
Time Elapsed: 00:00:00.0005881
========== Finished ==========



### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Hard to see the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is focused with a dash-line box when navigating through Tab in Blue/Blue (Extra Contrast)/Light themes" (#8963) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Related https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1244648

## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.5.0.6353
VS Version: Master\29619.96
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Launch VS and click “Create a New Project” button.
2. Create an ASP.NET Web Application (.NET Framework) project (Single Page Application).
3. Open PM UI of this project and go to ‘Updates’ tab.
4. Navigate by Tab to the package list.
5. There is a dash-line showing on the outer edge of the first package.
6. Hit Tab again, attempt to focus on the check-box of this package.
## Expected
Easy to see the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is focused with a dash-line box. 
## Actual
Hard to see the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is focused with a dash-line box as below screenshot. Note: actually it is focused since you can see the “√” when hitting Space on keyboard.
![CannotSeeDashLineBox](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/71239864-91412200-2342-11ea-9f5e-a25e991c32ea.png)
## Note
1. It repro on 16.2 GA (D16.2\29116.123) with implicit NuGet 5.2.0.6090.
2. It doesn’t repro in Dark theme.
3. Resolution suggested: make the bash-box a little bigger than the check-box.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Updates Tab checkboxes do not work well with screen-readers" (#10449) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Related: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1245157

Work with the Automation peer so that checkbox state of a package item is properly announced to a screen reader.

Somewhat related issue regarding focus on this control:  https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8963

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "When in Visual Studio, a build makes an NU1004 or NU1105 disappear from the error list and leads to NETSDK1005 " (#10486) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): Visual Studio

Product version: 16.9 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 

## Repro steps and/or sample project

When a restore fails due to locked mode or because of an invalid project a build makes the error disappear in VS. 

The reason for that is that the assets file contains *no targets*

Originally filled in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10462#issuecomment-767871895. 

### Verbose Logs

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enhance the coding guidelines - add rule for parameter names & namespace names" (#10485) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Empty frameworkReferences groups should be generated when packing multitargeted projects" (#10218) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Pack the following project:

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFrameworks>netcoreapp3.1;net5.0;net5.0-windows</TargetFrameworks>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$([MSBuild]::GetTargetPlatformIdentifier($(TargetFramework)))' == 'Windows' Or
                            ('$([MSBuild]::GetTargetFrameworkIdentifier($(TargetFramework)))' == '.NETCoreApp' And
                             $([MSBuild]::VersionLessThan($([MSBuild]::GetTargetFrameworkVersion('$(TargetFramework)')), 5.0)))">
    <DefineConstants>$(DefineConstants);WINDOWS</DefineConstants>
    <UseWindowsForms>true</UseWindowsForms>
    <UseWpf>true</UseWpf>
  </PropertyGroup>

</Project>
```

**Expected**: NuGet package has an empty `net5.0` group under frameworkReferences.
**Actual**: No `net5.0` frameworkReferences group:

```xml
    <frameworkReferences>
      <group targetFramework=".NETCoreApp3.1">
        <frameworkReference name="Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App" />
      </group>
      <group targetFramework="net5.0-windows7.0">
        <frameworkReference name="Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App" />
      </group>
    </frameworkReferences>
```

This means that if a project that targets `net5.0` references this NuGet package, it will resolve the netcoreapp3.1 frameworkReferences group, which will add a reference to the WindowsDesktop shared framework, which will generate an error because the project does not target `net5.0-windows`:

> NETSDK1136: The target platform must be set to Windows   (usually by including '-windows' in the TargetFramework property) when using   Windows Forms or WPF, or referencing projects or packages that do so.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error NETSDK1005 “Assets file 'C: \Users\v-minlon\source\repos\RRR02\RRR02\obj\project.assets.json' doesn't have a target for 'net5.0'.” occurs when building solution after enabling “RestoreLockedMode”" (#10462) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
VS Version: Main\30917.09
NuGet Version : Dev\5.9.0.7050
OS Version: Windows-10-Enterprise-19H2.
## Installation
1. Install VS Main\30917.09: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=4380664&view=ms.vss-build-web.run-extensions-tab
2. Install NuGet Dev\5.9.0.7050: \\\ddfiles\drops\NuGet\Drops\CI\NuGet.Client\Dev\5.9.0.7050\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.Tools.vsix
## Repro steps 
1. Create a C# Console Application (.Net Core) project.
2. Install a few ‘PackageReference’ packages into the projects.
3. Set MSBuild property “RestorePackagesWithLockFile” to true in csproj file.
  `<RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile>`
4. Do a restore.
5. Check it should have generated ‘packages.lock.json’ file alongside *.csproj file.
6. Set msbuild property “RestoreLockedMode” to “true”.
    `<RestoreLockedMode>true</RestoreLockedMode>`
7. Install another package.
8. It should still work fine and update ‘packages.lock.json’ file.
9. Manually add a new PackageReference item into csproj file.
  `<PackageReference Include="NUnit" Version="3.12.0" />` 
 10. Perform restore.
 11. Build the solution.
## Expected 
Only expected error NU1004 shows on error list when building the solution.
## Actual
Error NETSDK1005 “Assets file 'C:\Users\v-minlon\source\repos\RRR02\RRR02\obj\project.assets.json' doesn't have a target for 'net5.0'” occurs when building the solution as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/104896775-8710ad80-59b2-11eb-94f6-7ef7b7a94fee.png)

## Notes
1. The issue also reproes on C# Class Library (.Net Framework) project, the error message as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/104896800-90017f00-59b2-11eb-9b36-00ca6e36cdc4.png)
2. The issue starts from Dev\5.9.0.7043.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
 
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	· **Nov. 11, 2020** – 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	· **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**  – 48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
 
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	· UTC-9 to UTC-2 – [Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	· UTC-1 to UTC+6 – [Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	· UTC+7 to UTC-10 – [Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
 
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	· **Nov. 11, 2020** – 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
 
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	· **Nov. 11, 2020** – 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	· **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**  – 48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
 
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	· UTC-9 to UTC-2 – [Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	· UTC-1 to UTC+6 – [Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	· UTC+7 to UTC-10 – [Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
